title: Selena Gomez rocks $29 T-shirt for pottery painting outing with her pal in LA
text:
She's gearing up for the release of her comeback single, Lose You To Love Me, on Wednesday.

And enjoying the calm before the storm, Selena Gomez was spotted enjoying a casual Saturday evening with her friend.

The 27-year-old picked up some takeaway dinner and then headed to the Color Me Mine pottery painting studio in Los Angeles.

Chilled night: Selena Gomez rocked a $29 T-shirt of Aaliyah on Saturday evening while spotted picking up some takeaway food and heading to a pottery painting class in Los Angeles with a friend

Selena kept things very casual and comfortable in an oversized vintage Aaliyah T-shirt retailing for $29.

She teamed the look with a pair of full length tights and chunky white sneakers for the outing.

The It Ain't Me singer accessorised her dressed down look with large hooped earrings and a pair of shades over her eyes.

Selena styled her brunette hair up into a high voluminous ponytail that was complete with a yellow scrunchie.

She appeared to be makeup free for the outing with her friend.

The beauty's outing comes as she gears up to drop her first solo single in nearly one-and-a-half years.

Gorgeous: Selena styled her brunette hair up into a high voluminous ponytail that was complete with a yellow scrunchie

Selena dropped the single cover and title, Lose You To Love Me, late last week along with a slew of throwback photos.

Her new song is set to come out on Wednesday 23 October and she's also teased some lyrics in the nostalgic posts.

'We always go into it blindly,' 'rose colored glasses all distorted,' 'I saw the signs and I ignored it,' 'I gave my all and they all know it,' 'I needed to lose you to love me,' and 'You promised the world,' are all lyrics she hinted to her 157 million followers.

Deep thoughts: 'We always go into it blindly,' 'rose colored glasses all distorted,' 'I saw the signs and I ignored it,' 'I gave my all and they all know it,' 'I needed to lose you to love me,' and 'You promised the world,' are all lyrics she hinted to her 157 million followers

In an appearance on The Tonight Show With Jimmy Fallon back in June, Selena revealed that she was 'actually done' with her newest album.

'I have to do, like, a few finishing things with it, but I'm just relieved,' she said.

'It took me four years now to even feel at a good place with this album, and it's just because I had such huge moments that happened in my life personally that [it was like] how was I going to capture that and how was I actually going to feel good about what I was saying. So, I kept going and I'm relieved now.'

The actress and singer rose to fame in the mid-2000's with appearances on popular TV shows such as Hannah Montana and The Suite Life Of Zack And Cody before starring in Disney's Wizards of Waverly Place from 2007 to 2012.
